wikipedia_page.main:
Henry Francis Fynn (29 March 1803 in Grosvenor Square, London, England – 20 September 1861 in Durban, Natal, South Africa) was an English traveler and trader.  He was among the first Europeans to make contact with Shaka Zulu.
His great wife was the Zulu princess Mavundlase. She is said to have succeeded to his chieftaincy upon his death.
Fynn's son by a junior wife, also named Henry Francis Fynn, attended St. Andrew's College, Grahamstown in 1858 and 1859.Fynn, Coenraad De Buys, John Dunn and Nathaniel Isaacs were amongst the most famous of South Africa's so-called White Chiefs.
